document.masterDocTitle: On the Baeocera Erichson (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Scaphidiinae) of Sabah, Malaysia, and a tale on mystified biodiversity

caption.paragraph:
Figures 1–7.
Baeocera spp.
, aedeagi; (1, 2)
B. omnigena
sp. nov. , in dorsal and lateral views, internal sac extruded, scale = 0.1 mm; (3) ditto, paramere in ventral view, scale = 0.05 mm. (4, 5)
B. rudis
sp. nov. , in dorsal and lateral views, scale = 0.1 mm; (6) ditto, paramere in ventral view, scale = 0.05 mm; (7) ditto, internal sac in dorsal view, scale = 0.05 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. The description of the species was based on a single male found at Umas, near Tawau. It is unique within the Bornean congeners in having parameres abruptly narrowed and a short flagellum in combination. These characters are shared with
B. pseudoincisa Löbl, 1984
and
B. manasensis Löbl, 1984
from India and
B. jeani Löbl, 2012
from Palawan.
